name: Sweet and Spicy Baked Keto Chicken Wings
author: SunnyDaysNora
summary: My family loves these low-carb and keto-friendly baked chicken wings! They're a staple around our house during football season. I love to serve them with blue cheese dressing for dipping.
ingredients: ¾ cup hot pepper sauce (such as Valentina®)
¼ cup sucralose sugar substitute (such as Splenda®)
3 pounds chicken wing pieces, drumettes and flats
½ cup blue cheese salad dressing  (Optional)
directions: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C)
Line a rimmed baking pan with foil
Spray a wire rack with cooking spray and set inside the baking pan
Melt butter in a small saucepan
Mix in hot sauce, sucralose, salt, and garlic powder
Remove from heat and set sauce aside
Place chicken wing pieces on the prepared rack
Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes
Remove from the oven, pour off any juices accumulated in the bottom of the pan, and turn chicken pieces over
Remove chicken from the oven and transfer to a large bowl
Cover with sauce and toss to coat
Return chicken to the rack on the baking pan and bake until no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, 15 to 30 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C)
